title: Quick Start with dssrip2
text: HEC-DSSVue installed machine, call dss_connect() supply path install folder: Alternatively, can download HEC Monolith Jars (associated dependencies) connect instead: default, HEC Monolith installs APPDATA. simplified startup, can add following options .Rprofile: Review dss_connect() dss_install_monolith() help files information configuration.
code: library(dssrip2)  dss_connect("C:/Program Files/HEC/HEC-DSSVue") dss_install_monolith() dss_connect(monolith = TRUE) # for HEC-DSSVue options(dss.home = "C:/Program Files/HEC/HEC-DSSVue")  # alternatively, for HEC Monolith in the default direcory options(dss.monolith = TRUE)

title: Quick Start with dssrip2
text: Start opening DSS File: file contains five datasets: daily flow timeseries 15-minute stage timeseries annual peak flow irregular timeseries annual peak stage irregular timeseries flow-elevation paired datasets DSS catalog can read R using dss_catalog(): dss_catalog() supports regex pattern matching subset path list: dssrip2 also provides variety functions provided assist manipulating DSS paths: dssrip2 provides function dss_read() read DSS datasets R. output format automatically deduced DSS data type: DSS regular irregular time series converted two-column data frames. DSS paired datasets converted two-column () data frames. DSS grid data converted SpatRasters (see package:terra information).
code: f = dss_open(system.file("extdata/example.dss", package = "dssrip2")) dss_catalog(f, condensed = TRUE) #> [1] "/BRANDYWINE CREEK/WILMINGTON, DE/FLOW/01Oct1946 - 30Sep2012/1DAY/USGS/"                    #> [2] "/BRANDYWINE CREEK/WILMINGTON, DE/FLOW-ANNUAL PEAK/30Apr1947 - 30Oct2012/IR-CENTURY/USGS/"  #> [3] "/BRANDYWINE CREEK/WILMINGTON, DE/FLOW-STAGE///GENERATED DATA PAIRS/"                       #> [4] "/BRANDYWINE CREEK/WILMINGTON, DE/GAGE HEIGHT/31Aug2012 - 30Sep2012/15MIN/USGS/"            #> [5] "/BRANDYWINE CREEK/WILMINGTON, DE/STAGE-ANNUAL PEAK/01JAN1900 - 01JAN2000/IR-CENTURY/USGS/" dss_catalog(f, "/.*/.*/FLOW.*/.*/.*/.*/") #> [1] "/BRANDYWINE CREEK/WILMINGTON, DE/FLOW/01Oct1946 - 30Sep2012/1DAY/USGS/"                   #> [2] "/BRANDYWINE CREEK/WILMINGTON, DE/FLOW-ANNUAL PEAK/30Apr1947 - 30Oct2012/IR-CENTURY/USGS/" #> [3] "/BRANDYWINE CREEK/WILMINGTON, DE/FLOW-STAGE///GENERATED DATA PAIRS/" path = "/BRANDYWINE CREEK/WILMINGTON, DE/FLOW/01Oct1946 - 30Sep2012/1DAY/USGS/"  # split path into parts dss_parts_split(path) #>                  A              B    C                     D    E    F #> 1 BRANDYWINE CREEK WILMINGTON, DE FLOW 01Oct1946 - 30Sep2012 1DAY USGS  # replace path part dss_parts_replace(path, list(B = "WILMINGTON, DELAWARE")) #> [1] "/BRANDYWINE CREEK/WILMINGTON, DELAWARE/FLOW/01Oct1946 - 30Sep2012/1DAY/USGS/"  # combine parts into path dss_parts_combine(list(A = "BASIN", B = "LOCATION", C = "PARAMETER",   D = "", E = "1DAY", F = "EXAMPLE")) #> [1] "/BASIN/LOCATION/PARAMETER//1DAY/EXAMPLE/" # read in a regular timeseries dss_read(f, "/BRANDYWINE CREEK/WILMINGTON, DE/FLOW//1DAY/USGS/") #>     datetime flow #> 1 1946-10-02  235 #> 2 1946-10-03  220 #> 3 1946-10-04  210 #> 4 1946-10-05  200 #> 5 1946-10-06  195 #>  [ reached 'max' / getOption("max.print") -- omitted 24102 rows ]  # read in a single chunk of a regular timeseries dss_read(f, "/BRANDYWINE CREEK/WILMINGTON, DE/FLOW/01JAN1948/1DAY/USGS/",   full = FALSE) #>     datetime flow #> 1 1948-01-02  522 #> 2 1948-01-03 2780 #> 3 1948-01-04 1030 #> 4 1948-01-05  590 #> 5 1948-01-06  518 #>  [ reached 'max' / getOption("max.print") -- omitted 361 rows ]  # read in irregular timeseries dss_read(f, "/BRANDYWINE CREEK/WILMINGTON, DE/FLOW-ANNUAL PEAK//IR-CENTURY/USGS/") #>     datetime flow-annual peak #> 1 1947-05-01             4730 #> 2 1948-09-11             5160 #> 3 1948-12-31             4940 #> 4 1950-08-04             4610 #> 5 1950-11-26            11500 #>  [ reached 'max' / getOption("max.print") -- omitted 62 rows ]  # read in a paired dataset dss_read(f, "/BRANDYWINE CREEK/WILMINGTON, DE/FLOW-STAGE///GENERATED DATA PAIRS/") #>   flow stage #> 1 2000  5.00 #> 2 3260  6.24 #> 3 3470  6.36 #> 4 3470  6.43 #> 5 3680  6.62 #>  [ reached 'max' / getOption("max.print") -- omitted 62 rows ]

title: Quick Start with dssrip2
text: dssrip2 Also provides write support time series paired data containers. reading data, dssrip2 determines appropriate DSS dataset type structure supplied input. good practice close DSS file finished working . part, dssrip2 call file’s $done() method completion every operation implicitly close file, can also explicitly close file: ’s !
code: outfile = tempfile(fileext = ".dss")  f = dss_create(outfile)  # create a regular timeseries from the LakeHuron dataset data(LakeHuron) lake_huron = data.frame(date = as.Date(sprintf("%d-10-01",   time(LakeHuron))), elev = as.vector(LakeHuron)) lake_huron_path = "/GREAT LAKES/LAKE HURON/ELEV//1YEAR/R DATASET/" lake_huron_meta = list(units = "feet", type = "INST")  dss_write(lake_huron, f, lake_huron_path, lake_huron_meta) #> Warning: Converting supplied timestamps to 'POSIXct' class, using default #> timezone etc/GMT+0  # create an irregular timeseries from the airquality dataset data(airquality) aq = do.call(rbind, lapply(split(airquality, airquality$Month),   function(x)     x[which.max(x$Temp), ])) temps = data.frame(date = as.Date(sprintf("1973-%d-%d",   aq$Month, aq$Day)), temperature = aq$Temp) temps_path = "/NEW YORK/NEW YORK CITY/TEMPERATURE//IR-YEAR/R DATASET/" temps_meta = list(units = "degrees F", type = "INST")  dss_write(temps, f, temps_path, temps_meta) #> Warning: Converting supplied timestamps to 'POSIXct' class, using default #> timezone etc/GMT+0  # create paired dataset from the Loblolly dataset data(Loblolly) growth = reshape(Loblolly, direction = "wide", idvar = "age", timevar = "Seed") names(growth) = gsub("height.", "seed_", names(growth)) growth_path = "//LOBLOLLY PINES/AGE-HEIGHT///R DATASET/" growth_meta = list(xunits = "years", yunits = "feet",   xtype = "UNT", ytype = "UNT", labels = names(growth)[2:ncol(growth)])  dss_write(growth, f, growth_path, growth_meta) dss_close(f)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Michael Koohafkan. Author, maintainer. Evan Heisman. Author. Cameron Bracken. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Koohafkan M, Heisman E, Bracken C (2023). dssrip2: DSS R Interface Project (2). https://github.com/mkoohafkan/dssrip2, https://hydroecology.net/dssrip2/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {dssrip2: DSS R Interface Project (2)},   author = {Michael Koohafkan and Evan Heisman and Cameron Bracken},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/mkoohafkan/dssrip2, https://hydroecology.net/dssrip2/}, }

title: DSS R Interface Project (2)
text: rewrite dssrip. Supports reading writing time series paired data DSS. Linux support read/write support DSS grid data planned.

title: DSS R Interface Project (2)
text: 64-bit install HEC-DSSVue 64-bit JDK required. load DSS functionality, call dss_connect() retrieve path using getOption("dss.home") path provided. suppress messages DSS, use message level provided, dss_message_level() retrieve level using getOption("dss.messagelevel"). can set either options .Rprofile:
code: library(dssrip2) dss_connect("path/to/HEC-DSSVue") dss_connect(message_level = 1L)  # or after calling dss_connect() dss_message_level(1L) # paste this into .Rprofile # (replace with the install path on your machine) options(   dss.home = "C:/Program Files/HEC/HEC-DSSVue",   dss.messagelevel = 1L )

title: DSS R Interface Project (2)
text: dssrip2 supports HEC Monolith. use Monolith automatically, set following options R profile: default, dssrip2 install HEC-Monolith %LOCALAPPDATA% folder, can overridden. option dss.monolith set TRUE, dssrip2 interpret dss.home option HEC-Monolith file path.

title: DSS R Interface Project (2)
text: Connections DSS files must handled manually user. create file connection, use DSS files usually close period inactivity, best practice users explicitly signal DSS finished working file calling file’s $done() method:
code: filepath = system.file("extdata/test.dss", package = "dssrip2") conn = dss_file(filepath) dss_close(conn) # or directly call conn$done()

title: DSS R Interface Project (2)
text: dssrip2 automatically detects data type read, function call can used reading time series paired data.
code: # time series dss_read(conn, "/BRANDYWINE CREEK/WILMINGTON, DE/FLOW/01JAN1946/1DAY/USGS/")  # paired data dss_read(conn, "/BRANDYWINE CREEK/WILMINGTON, DE/FLOW-STAGE///GENERATED DATA PAIRS/")

title: DSS R Interface Project (2)
text: dssrip2 deduces data type write based supplied R object, function call can used reading time series paired data. However, writing DSS objects requires additional attributes must explicitly supplied user:
code: tf = tempfile(fileext = ".dss") conn = dss_create(tf)  # time series data(Nile) nile = data.frame(datetime = as.Date(sprintf("%d-10-01", time(Nile))),   flow = as.vector(Nile) * 1e8) nile_meta = list(units = "cubic meters", type = "PER-CUM") path = "//NILE RIVER/VOLUME//1YEAR/R DATASET/" dss_write(nile, conn, path, nile_meta)  # paired data data(CO2) uptake = reshape(CO2[c("Plant", "conc", "uptake")],   direction = "wide", idvar = "conc", timevar = "Plant") names(uptake) = gsub("uptake.", "", names(uptake)) uptake_meta = list(xtype = "LINEAR", ytype = "LINEAR",   xunits = "mL/L", yunits = "umol/m^2",   labels = names(uptake)[2:ncol(uptake)]) path = "//PLANT CO2 UPTAKE/CONCENTRATION-UPTAKE///R DATASET/" dss_write(uptake, conn, path, uptake_meta)

title: POSIXct to HecTime — as_hectime
text: Convert R POSIXct datetime Java HecTime.

title: POSIXct to HecTime — as_hectime
text: x POSIXct timestamp. granularity minimum time interval. Can "secs" "mins". as_period TRUE, adjust timestamp represent period, timestamp specifying period end time (0100 2400 hours).

title: Query Maven Assets — asset_query_maven
code: asset_query_maven(   artifactId,   repository = "maven-releases",   group = "",   version = "",   maven.extension = "jar",   maven.classifier = "",   url = "https://search.maven.org/solrsearch/select" )

title: Query Maven Assets — asset_query_maven
text: artifactId Maven artifact ID. repository Maven repository. group group asset belongs . maven.extension asset file extension. maven.classifier asset classifier. url repository base URL.

title: Query Nexus Assets — asset_query_nexus
code: asset_query_nexus(   artifactId,   repository = "maven-releases",   group = "mil.army.usace.hec",   version = "",   maven.extension = "jar",   maven.classifier = "",   url = "https://www.hec.usace.army.mil/nexus/service/rest/v1/search/assets" )

title: Query Nexus Assets — asset_query_nexus
text: artifactId Maven artifact ID. repository Maven repository. group group asset belongs . maven.extension asset file extension. maven.classifier asset classifier. url repository base URL.

Java Vector To Strings — .javaVectorToStrings
text: Convert java vectors returned catalog functions strings.

title: DSS Assertions — dss-assertions
text: Helper functions DSS type format checking.

title: DSS Assertions — dss-assertions
code: assert_dss_connected()  assert_dss_file(file)  assert_path_format(path)  assert_parts_format(parts)  assert_read_support(obj)  assert_write_support(obj)  assert_timeseries(obj)  assert_timeseries_type(type)  assert_timeseries_interval(type)  assert_paired(obj)  assert_grid(obj)  assert_attributes(obj, attributes)

title: DSS Assertions — dss-assertions
text: assert_dss_connected(): Assert DSS dependencies loaded. assert_dss_file(): Assert supplied object DSS file handle. assert_path_format(): Assert supplied path correct format. assert_parts_format(): Assert set supplied parts named complete. assert_read_support(): Assert supplied rJava object DSS timeseries. assert_write_support(): Assert supplied rJava object DSS timeseries. assert_timeseries(): Assert supplied rJava object DSS timeseries. assert_timeseries_type(): Assert supplied time series type recognized. assert_timeseries_interval(): Assert supplied time series interval recognized. assert_paired(): Assert supplied rJava object DSS paired data container. assert_grid(): Assert supplied rJava object DSS grid data container. assert_attributes(): Assert supplied attributes match requirements supplied rJava object.

title: Read DSS Attributes — dss_attributes
text: file DSS file handle, e.g., output dss_open(). path DSS path query attributes .

title: Get DSS Paths — dss_catalog
code: dss_catalog(file, pattern = "*", condensed = TRUE, rebuild = FALSE)

title: Get DSS Paths — dss_catalog
text: file DSS file handle, e.g., output dss_open(). pattern character string containing regular expression matched DSS pathname catalog. condensed TRUE returned condensed path catalog. rebuild TRUE, force rebuild catalog.

title: Close DSS File — dss_close
text: Close DSS file. function provided completion interface strictly required methods can called directly file object (.e., file$done()).

title: Close DSS File — dss_close
text: file DSS file handle, e.g., output dss_open(). implicit TRUE, use method done() instead close().

title: Connect To DSS — dss_require
code: dss_require(   dss_home = getOption("dss.home"),   message_level = getOption("dss.messagelevel"),   monolith = TRUE )  dss_connect(   dss_home = getOption("dss.home"),   message_level = getOption("dss.messagelevel"),   monolith = getOption("dss.monolith") )

title: Connect To DSS — dss_require
text: dss_home path HEC-DSS install folder. message_level integer specifying DSS message level. Default 2L. Use 1L suppress messages DSS. monolith TRUE, connect HEC-Monolith libraries.

title: Connect To DSS — dss_require
text: dss_connect() dss_require() configure JVM use HEC-DSS Java library. dss_require() designed use inside packages; returns FALSE gives warning (rather error dss_connect() ) HEC-DSS Java library loaded correctly.

title: Connect To DSS (Unix) — dss_connect_unix
text: dss_home path HEC-DSS install folder. message_level integer specifying DSS message level. Default 2L. Use 1L suppress messages DSS. monolith TRUE, connect HEC-Monolith libraries.

title: Connect To DSS (Windows) — dss_connect_win
text: dss_home path HEC-DSS install folder. message_level integer specifying DSS message level. Default 2L. Use 1L suppress messages DSS. monolith TRUE, connect HEC-Monolith libraries.

title: DSS File Conversion — dss_convert
text: file DSS file handle, e.g., output dss_open(). destination file path.

title: Delete DSS Records — dss_delete
code: dss_delete(file, path, full = TRUE, squeeze = FALSE)

title: Delete DSS Records — dss_delete
text: file DSS file handle, e.g., output dss_open(). path vector DSS paths. full TRUE, delete entire dataset. FALSE, delete section specified D Part path. squeeze TRUE, squeeze file deleting records.

title: Install Monolith — dss_install_monolith
code: dss_install_monolith(install_path, overwrite = TRUE, requirements_file)  dss_install_monolith_win(assets, install_path, overwrite)  dss_install_monolith_unix(assets, install_path, overwrite)

title: Install Monolith — dss_install_monolith
text: install_path directory download monolith libraries . overwrite TRUE, delete existing data install_path recreate. requirements_file list required assets. expert use .

title: DSS Message Level — dss_message_level
text: message_level integer specifying DSS message level. Default 2L. Use 1L suppress messages DSS.

title: DSS File Handle — dss_open
text: filename Location DSS file open. version DSS version created file (6 7).

title: DSS File Handle — dss_open
text: Objects created function must explicitly closed using $close() $done() methods. function fails message javaHeclib.dll found, usually indicates dss.home set correctly.

title: Replace DSS Path Parts — dss_parts_replace
text: Replace DSS path parts specified values.

title: Replace DSS Path Parts — dss_parts_replace
text: path vector DSS paths. replacement list replacement path parts "", "B", "C", "D", "E", "F".

title: DSS Path To Parts — dss_parts_split
text: path vector DSS paths. keep TRUE, preserve supplied paths output.

title: Read DSS Records — dss_read
text: file DSS file handle, e.g., output dss_open(). path DSS path extract. full TRUE, read entire dataset. FALSE, read section specified D Part path.

title: Read DSS Records — dss_read
text: data frame. time series object, first column "datetime". columns named according DSS "parameter" value specified object metadata.

title: Read DSS Records — dss_read
text: returned data frame includes additional attributes "dss.type" "dss.units" describing DSS data format.

title: Squeeze a DSS File — dss_squeeze
text: Calls squeeze method file remove deleted overwritten data.

title: Squeeze a DSS File — dss_squeeze
text: file DSS file handle, e.g., output dss_open().

title: DSS Times From POSIXct — dss_times_from_posix
text: datetimes POSIXct vector. Default 60L (one  minute). dss_interval DSS time interval, e.g., "15MIN", "1DAY", "IR-CENTURY", etc.

title: DSS Time Vector — dss_times_to_posix
text: times vector DSS times. info list attributes relevant processing timestamps. Must include "timeGranularitySeconds", "timeIntervalSeconds", "timeZoneRawOffset", "type".

title: DSS Time Zone — dss_timezone
text: Convert DSS raw timezone offset R timezone.

title: DSS Time Zone — dss_timezone
text: tzoffset DSS object's "timeZoneRawOffset" attribute (time offset milliseconds).

title: Grid to DSS — dss_to_grid
text: r raster. attributes list hec.io.GridContainer attributes.

title: Paired Data to DSS — dss_to_paired
text: Convert data frame DSS Paired Data object.

title: Paired Data to DSS — dss_to_paired
text: d data frame. attributes list PairedDataContainer attributes.

title: Timeseries to DSS — dss_to_timeseries
text: Convert data frame DSS Time Series object.

title: Timeseries to DSS — dss_to_timeseries
text: d data frame. attributes list TimeSeriesContainer attributes. dss_interval DSS time interval, e.g., "15MIN", "1DAY", "IR-CENTURY", etc.

title: DSS File Version — dss_version
text: file DSS file handle, e.g., output dss_open().

title: Write DSS Records — dss_write
text: Write DSS time series, paired dataset, grid DSS file.

title: Write DSS Records — dss_write
text: x dataframe (Time Series Paired Data) raster (Grid) write DSS. file DSS file handle, e.g., output dss_open(). path DSS path write. attributes named list DSS attributes.

title: dssrip — dssrip
text: wrapper HEC-DSS Java API allowing interface R many common hydrologic models. rewrite original "dssrip" package.

title: Format Datetimes — format_datetimes
text: x vector coerced datetimes default_tx default timezone use coercing objects without specified timezone.

title: Fill NA Values — na_fill
